intro: Crepidorhopalon welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschii mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Namib Desert in Namibia. It is a shrub characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, palmate leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is adapted to extreme conditions, with a deep root system and the ability to store water in its stems. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important species for studying desert flora and ecological resilience.
